Club Events    NYU Social Innovation Symposium 2014  — February 21, 2014                         Date : February 21, 2014 Location : NYU Stern The social enterprise communities of NYU's Leonard N. Stern School of Business, School of Law, and Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service are co-hosting this year's 4th Annual NYU Social Innovation Symposium (SIS). This year's SIS theme, Beyond Skylines: New Ideas for Urban Ecosystems, will frame a conversation on social innovations that aim to make urban communities around the world smarter and stronger. The board of SIS student leaders is pleased to welcome Ben Rattray, Founder and CEO of Change.org as the event's morning keynote speaker. To register and to learn more information about the NYU SIS program, please visit www.nyusis.com . Social Innovation Symposium 2014  — February 21, 2014                         Date : February 21, 2014 Location : NYU Stern The social enterprise communities of NYU's Leonard N. Stern School of Business, School of Law, and Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service are co-hosting this year's 4th Annual NYU Social Innovation Symposium (SIS). This year's SIS theme, Beyond Skylines: New Ideas for Urban Ecosystems, will frame a conversation on social innovations that aim to make urban communities around the world smarter and stronger. The board of SIS student leaders is pleased to welcome Ben Rattray, Founder and CEO of Change.org as the event's morning keynote speaker. To register and to learn more information about the NYU SIS program, please visit www.nyusis.com . Berkley Scholarship Program   Loan Programs   Teaching & Graduate Fellowships   Resources for Military Veterans   Resources for Social Enterprise   Tuition & Cost of Attendance     Admissions Request Information   Apply   Selection Criteria   Deadlines   Notification & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   Directors' Tips   FAQs     Meet With Us Visit Stern   Travel Directions   Events and Webinars   Videos   Day in the Life Student Videos   Podcasts   Virtual Tour   Contact a Student               Home / Programs & Admissions / Full-time MBA / Academics / Specializations / Social Innovation and Impact                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Social Innovation and Impact    Courses in the Social Innovation and Impact specialization blend social and environmental perspectives with the more traditional economic perspective. They provide innovative conceptual frameworks, strategies and implementation skills necessary to create substantial social as well as economic value in for-profit, nonprofit and public sectors.     Sample Courses:                           Corporate Branding and CSR       Energy and the Environment       Examining the Nonprofit Capital Market       Foundations of Social Entrepreneurship       Investing for Environmental and Social Impact                           Global Poverty Alleviation       Investing in Microfinance       International Social Impact Strategies       Social Venture Capital       Social Problem-Based Entrepreneurship                        Please note that this is a selection of courses and is subject to change. For more information, visit the course index .             Especially Applicable to Careers in Social Enterprise , Entrepreneurship and Management such as:                           Business Development       Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)       Economic Development/Microfinance       Entrepreneurship                           Management Consulting       Nonprofit Management       Social Entrepreneurship       Socially Responsible Investing
